alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 8:04PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A heavy shower will impact portions of Nicholas, south central Braxton, southwestern Webster and east central Clay Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 801 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a heavy shower 8 miles southwest of Birch River, or 9 miles north of Summersville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Richwood, Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Widen, Canvas, Muddlety, Nettie, Calvin, Kesslers Cross Lanes and Mount Nebo. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 32 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
